title-group.article-title: Jacobs' Paper Discussion Develops Additional Points Worth Studying

abstract.p: DISCUSSION of the paper, "Aerodynamics of Wing Sections for Airplanes," by Eastman N. Jacobs, is published herewith. The paper was printed in the S.A.E. Journal for March, 1934, pp. 82-91. It was awarded the Wright Brothers Medal for 1933 and considers the air forces acting on airfoil sections, their origin, and the nature of the differences between the air forces acting on an ideal airfoil section and on an actual one. The effects of viscosity and separation of the flow from the airfoil surface are treated also in the paper which, finally, devotes consideration to the variation of the aerodynamic properties of sections with changes in the section shape.

p.mixed-citation: Journées Techniques Internationale de l'Aéronautique, Blondel La Rougery, Paris, 1932; Quelques Problèmes Actuels de l'Aerodynamiqtte. by Theodor von Karman.

Handbuch der Experimental Physik, vol. 4, part 1, p. 251.
S.A.E. Journal, January, 1930, p. 15; Wings—a Coordinated System of Basic Design, by Ralph H. Upson.
